text:
Hey all,
I’m sure i’ve seen a fields.json line which is specifically for if you want to change a field name but want it to inherit what the previous value was if it’s not set. does anyone know what it is?
I think it may have been in one of the dev webinars or something

It wasn’t one of the documented things, it was different to inheritted i’m pretty sure
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/module-theme-fields-overview>

Hi everyone,
Not sure if this is the right channel but I am trying to modify my subscription page templates so some subscription types are not visible to users that will receive our emails when they click on the "manage preferences" to unsubscribe from some emails when I use the html coding environment in the "design manager" page.
Please see my script attached <https://christianfamilycare-my.sharepoint.com/:w:/g/personal/pogobor_cfcare_org/EUvrEsHi2w5Nnz0-Xltijn0Bx45ukL8nZWuArB5ABrFwSw?e=AWeJeo|here>.
I would appreciate your insight on this.

I am creating a new blog_listing HTML + HUBL template for a custom theme. Based on this information, I should use the Blog Post module to list the blogs:
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/modules/default-modules#blog-posts>

Fine, but it generates random styling. How do we overwrite or set our own styles on this beast?

<div class="blog-listing-wrapper">
      {% module "blog_posts"
        path="@HubSpot/blog_posts"
        layout="sideBySide"
        displayForEachListItem=[
          "image",
          "title",
          "authorName",
          "tags",
          "publishDate",
          "description",
          "button"
        ]
      %}
    </div>
